item.title: Expressing support for the designation of May 2021 as Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of May 2022 as Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. (text: CR S2366-2367)

summary.text: This resolution (1) expresses support for the designation of May 2021 as Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month; (2) recognizes the contribution of motorcycles to the transportation mix; (3) encourages motorcycle awareness by all road users; (4) recognizes that motorcyclists have a right to the road and that all motorists should safely share the roadways; (5) encourages rider safety education, training, and proper gear for safe motorcycle operation; and (6) supports the goals of Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month.

bill.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of May 2021 as "Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
